revision.comment: Cerebellum moved page [[Talk:Battle of Now Zad]] to [[Talk:Battle of Nawzad]]: I know some sources say Now Zad, but we should be consistent with [[Nawzad, Afghanistan]] and [[Nawzad District]]

==Nawzad vs Now Zad?== I see that Now Zad has been replaced with Nawzad. I've been spelling it Now Zad as that is what current news agencies are reporting/spelling it as, rather than the previous spelling Nawzad. This may have been the British spelling? Not sure. My opinion is to go with the current spelling. --[[User:Ouketi.ego|Ouketi.ego]] ([[User talk:Ouketi.ego|talk]]) 01:36, 06 July 2009 (UTC)
When I served in Now Zad in 2006 that was how we spelt it. I would also like to point out that there were on 53 british soldiers stationed there hence why we could never defeat the Taliban. So if a company of 300 US marines is called small what the hell were we? [[User:Tangotwozero|Tangotwozero]] ([[User talk:Tangotwozero|talk]]) 10:32, 22 October 2009 (UTC)
:The spelling of places should be the official woding used by a countries government, used by those living in the location. Unfortunately Media producers and Journalists, sending back reports via video link or text, will usually corrupt place names to how they sound at the time to them. That then gets onto the international media and assumed to be correct by the general public. However, although I have seen 'Nawzad', used in some archived publications, the wording 'Naw Zad' is used on this map [http://www.aims.org.af/maps/topomaps_bg/PI41-16.pdf] produced by the [http://www.aims.org.af Afghanistan Managment Information Service]. It is also the wording used in this [http://www.who.int/disasters/repo/12771.pdf 'Asia-Pacific Daily Report' April 9, 2004 (pdf file)], also this Asian Media group News website [http://www.dawn.com/wps/wcm/connect/dawn-content-library/dawn/news/world/04-afghan-troops-capture-helmand-nawzad-district-qs-17 Dawn News], by Google Maps and the Wiki articles [[Nawzad]] and [[Nawzad District]]. Whilst 'Now Zad' is used on an US Air Force, Defense Mapping Agency Aerospace Center, air navigation map from the 80s:- [http://www.lib.utexas.edu/maps/middle_east_and_asia/txu-oclc-8322829-g_6.jpg] and Windows Live (Bing Maps). [[User:Richard Harvey|Richard Harvey]] ([[User talk:Richard Harvey|talk]]) 10:53, 23 October 2009 (UTC)
== Battle? == It's the longest battle in history? This is campigan, no battle. [[User:Omega933|Omega933]] ([[User talk:Omega933|talk]]) 16:39, 21 March 2011 (UTC)
== External links modified ==
Hello fellow Wikipedians,
I have just added archive links to {{plural:1|one external link|1 external links}} on [[Battle of Now Zad]]. Please take a moment to review [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?diff=prev&oldid=706691804 my edit]. If necessary, add {{tlx|cbignore}} after the link to keep me from modifying it. Alternatively, you can add {{tlx|nobots|deny{{=}}InternetArchiveBot}} to keep me off the page altogether. I made the following changes: *Added archive https://web.archive.org/20090513092217/http://www.marines.mil/units/marforcent/spmagtfa/Pages/NewsStoryPages/2009/USMarinesStrikeInsurgentPositionsinNowZad,Afghanistan.aspx to http://www.marines.mil/units/marforcent/spmagtfa/Pages/NewsStoryPages/2009/USMarinesStrikeInsurgentPositionsinNowZad,Afghanistan.aspx
When you have finished reviewing my changes, please set the ''checked'' parameter below to '''true''' to let others know.
